metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3212 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference issue was found in the gfs2 file system in the Linux kernel. It occurs on corrupt gfs2 file systems when the evict code tries to reference the journal descriptor structure after it has been freed and set to NULL. A privileged local user could use this flaw to cause a kernel panic. Yang Lan discovered that the GFS2 file system implementation in the Linux kernel could attempt to dereference a null pointer in some situations. An attacker could use this to construct a malicious GFS2 image that, when mounted and operated on, could cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3212` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1123-aws - 4.4.0-1123.129
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> requires a corrupted gfs2 file system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1123.129').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279~14.04.1').
